content.description: Slightly dirty, but pretty fun either way.
content.location: Start on the left arete using some holds about chest height. Make a move up to a slopey ledge and work your way up.

content.description:
Excellent slab/arete problem.

Great rock, great movement, great landing.

Crux would probably be the final few moves maybe
content.protection: a few pads are more than enough
content.location:
Rght arete on the side of boulder facing road.

Start low on the arete and balance up to the flat top out.

Down climb the back of the boulder

content.description:
Thin moves up an excellent slab.

A little awkward for the first few moves, but then gets fun.
content.location:
Start low in the middle of the face. Climb slightly to the right, and then up through the bullet holes.

downclimb the back of the boulder

content.description:
Start standing with the left hand on a decent pinch on the arete at around 6 feet and the right hand on one of the underclings located in the center of the face. Establish on the wall with some difficulty and piece together a way to to the top.

A short, but very fun problem on perfect rock and arguably the best line on the boulder.
content.location: This is located to the right of 'Gutshot' and to the left of 'Moneyshot'. It shares the arete with 'Gutshot', but climbs the right side of the arete instead of the left.
